items.title: Q4 result impact: Schaeffler, Ceat shares rise up to 8% on standout earnings, Praj shares down on weak show
items.description: Q4FY25 results reactions: Schaeffler India and Ceat's share surged while Praj Industries shares fell sharply on earnings impact.

items.title: Trent: Q4 FY25 margin surprises positively
items.description: The company has huge headroom for growth and is likely to deliver robust earnings over the medium to long run.

items.title: Vishal Mega Mart shares jump 6% on solid Q4FY25 profit jump, revenue and SSSG higher
items.description: Vishal Mega Mart Share Price: The retail major's EBITDA increased nearly 43 percent YoY to Rs 357 crore in Q4 FY25, with adjusted EBITDA margin at 14 percent. The company added 28 stores during the fourth quarter.

items.title: Can the Bajaj Finance stock sustain the rally?
items.description: FY25 earnings marred by elevated provisions

items.title: PCBL: Russian advantage now posing as a liability
items.description: In the last couple of years, the company benefitted from shortages of Russian supplies of carbon black to the European markets due to the Russia-Ukraine war and related sanctions

items.title: Can IndusInd bury its troubled past and move on?
items.description: A lot will depend on the type of leadership installed to restore the bank’s health

items.title: Alembic Pharma shares gain on EIR from USFDA for Panelav facility
items.description: Alembic Pharma Share Price | A meeting of board of directors of the company will be held on May 6, 2025, to consider audited financialrResults of the company for the quarter and financial year ended 31st March, 2025 and recommend dividend on equity shares, if any, for the financial year ended 31st March, 2025.

items.title: Strides Pharma shares gain on acquiring 4 ANDAs for US market
items.description: Strides Pharma Science share price| The portfolio consists of liquids and immediate release solid orals which are in the therapeutic segment to treat infections associated with UTIs (Urinary Tract Infections), Pain Management, Allergy Symptoms and Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD/ ADHD) and Narcolepsy, company said.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex, Nifty trade flat amid volatility; Bajaj twins, Tata Motors top losers
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: HDFC Life, Power Grid Corp, Sun Pharma, Cipla, Hindalco are among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers are Bajaj Finserv, Bajaj Finance, Trent, Tata Motors and SBI. On the sectoral front, realty index up 3 percent, pharma index up 1 percent, while PSU Bank index down 1 percent. BSE Midcap index is flat and smallcap index down 0.6 percent.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) buying continued on 10th consecutive session on April 29 as they bought equities worth Rs 2385 crore. Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) also extended their buying on third day as they purchased equities of Rs 1369 crore.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Bharat Dynamics, Cochin Shipyard, Max Financial Services, Alkem Labs, Bharti Airtel, and others on April 30?
items.description: The benchmark indices need to decisively close above the previous day's high for a further upward move; until then, consolidation may be seen. Below are some short-term trading ideas to conside.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Bajaj Finance, IndusInd Bank, IndiaMART, Schaeffler India, Vishal Mega Mart, Prestige Estates, Strides Pharma in focus on 30 April
items.description: Stocks to watch, 30 Apr: Stocks like Bajaj Finserv, Bharat Petroleum Corporation, Jana Small Finance Bank, UTI Asset Management Company, Star Health, Ceat, Shoppers Stop, CIE Automotive India, Praj Industries, Indostar Capital Finance, Fedbank Financial Services, and State Bank of India will be in focus on April 30.

items.title: Wall Street edges higher even as trade negotiations and tech earnings keep investors on edge
items.description: A flurry of results is expected this week, with nearly one-third of S&P 500 firms scheduled to report. Big Tech will be in the spotlight, with Meta and Microsoft on deck for Wednesday, followed by Apple and Amazon on Thursday.

items.title: Realty stocks surge up to 5% on investor interest ahead of Godrej, Phoenix results
items.description: Phoenix Mills is set to report its January-March quarter earnings on April 30, while Godrej Properties will announce its earnings on May 3. Investor interest also remains high on the auspicious occasion of Akshaya Tritiya.

items.title: Buy ACC; target of Rs 2475: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on ACC has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 2475 in its research report dated April 30, 2025.

items.title: Buy Ambuja Cement; target of Rs 625: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on Ambuja Cement has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 625 in its research report dated April 30, 2025.

items.title: Buy Greenply Industries; target of Rs 423: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on Greenply Industries has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 423 in its research report dated April 30, 2025.

items.title: Buy Ultratech Cement; target of Rs 15,210: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on Ultratech Cement has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 15,210 in its research report dated April 29, 2025.

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty extend gains for the third straight day | Closing Bell
items.description: Sensex, Nifty extend gains for the third straight day. Nifty ends above 24,350 in a choppy session. India VIX jumps over 4%; broader indices underperform. Market sentiment muted; Advance-decline ratio at 1:2. Nifty PSU Bank worst performer; SBI down ahead of Q4. Nifty Realty, Pharma, IT top sectoral performers. Nifty 50 gainers: HDFC Life, Maruti, Bharti Airtel. Nifty 50 losers: Bajaj Twins, Trent, Tata Motors. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Nilesh Jain, Head VP- Derivative and Technical Research, Centrum Broking Ltd to navigate market movement.

items.title: Bajaj Holdings Shares Fall 3.17% in Today's Trading Session
items.description: Moneycontrol's sentiment analysis, as of April 30, 2025, indicates a bullish outlook for Bajaj Holdings.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty snap two-day gaining streak amid volatility; mid, smallcaps tumble nearly 2%
items.description: Foreign investors continue to lend crucial support. In the past 10 trading sessions alone, foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have pumped in a net Rs 37,325 crore into Indian equities.

items.title: FIIs extend buying streak to 11th session, infuse Rs 50 crore in equities; DIIs pump in Rs 1,792 crore
items.description: For the year so far, FIIs have been net sellers of shares worth Rs 1.37 lakh crore, while DIIs have net bought Rs 2.06 lakh crore worth of shares.

items.title: India’s long-term story remains strong, but valuations still a hurdle for foreign investors: Macquarie’s Viktor Shvets
items.description: 'India is not growing at 8 percent, but it still offers one of the fastest sustainable growth rates globally,' he said.

items.title: US Fed may no longer lead the global rate cycle, says Macquarie's Viktor Shvets
items.description: Some economies will battle high inflation, while others may slide into stagflation. Still others—like China—could face deepening disinflation, said the Macquarie strategist.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on April 30
items.description: Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty have snapped their two-day winning run to close in the red with marginal losses.

items.title: Technical View: Nifty holds 24,300 in choppy session; support lies at 24,200
items.description: Among sectors, Realty index added nearly 2 percent and Pharma index rose 0.4 percent, while media, PSU Bank indices down 2 percent each and Energy, IT, Consumer Durables down 0.3-0.9 percent.
